Solution:

Cytotrophoblast The arrow marked structure in the given image is cytotrophoblast.

questions.text: Tertiary villi develops from which of the following structures? Cytotrophoblast Extra embryonic mesoderm Blood vessels Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1,2,3 Tertiary villi is a complex containing a) cytotrophoblast,with b) extra embryonic mesoderm and invading c) blood vessels. Primary villi develops from a) cytotrophoblast. Secondary villi develops from a) cytotrophoblast with invading b) extra embryonic mesoderm

@dams_new_robot

questions.text: First structure developed to determine craniocaudal axis of embryo?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Prechordal Plate Prechordal plate is the first structure developed to determine craniocaudal axis of embryo whereas b) Notochord is the First structure developed to determine right and left axis in embryo. Hence c) Both a & b and d) None of the above are incorrect.

@dams_new_robot

questions.text: Identify the correct sequence of development from primitive streak:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Endoderm - Mesoderm- Ectoderm Primitive streak gives rise to endoderm followed by mesoderm followed by ectoderm in sequential order.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Ectoderm – Mesoderm- Endoderm, Option: C. Ectoderm – Endoderm – Mesoderm and Option: D. Mesoderm- Ectoderm- Endoderm are all incorrect.

@dams_new_robot

questions.text: True about trophoblast? Consists of cytotrophoblast and syncytiotrophoblast Forms chorion Formed from outer cell mass Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1,2,3 Trophoblast is c) Formed from outer cell mass It a) Consists of cytotrophoblast and syncytiotrophoblast and b) Forms chorion along with somatopleuric extra embryonic mesoderm

@dams_new_robot

questions.text: A male new-born has a hemangioma on the left temporal region of his face and scalp. The cells forming the hemangioma are derived from which of the following cell layers?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Mesoderm only Hemangioma- Tumor in the blood vessels – blood vessels from mesoderm only. A hemangioma is a usually benign vascular tumor derived from blood vessel cell types, and blood vessels are mesoderm derivatives only.
